Tables

Tabular data can be problematic due to a range of data formats and restrictive viewport sizes. A generic table has been designed in order to work with endless data sources and accross multiple screen sizes. Generic tables are not technically responsive due to unknown table data which could arise in the future.

Note on table designs

  • Columns to be equally spaced and can scale down proportionality for smaller screen widths
  • No vertical dividing lines, only horizontal to separate rows
  • Right aligned table cells for numerical content

Configuration options

You can use combinations of the following configuration options to create tables like those illustrated above.

Class name Effect Remarks
.table Defines an element to be a table component Required. Placed on the table element
.table__cell Provides base styles for what a normal cell in the table should look like Required. Placed on ths and tds that will have content in them
.table__heading Provides heading styles on a cell Required. Placed on ths and tds that will have content in them
.table__heading--underline Adds a bottom border to the heading Optional. Placed on .table__heading elements
